snippet: Phoenix has become the first American city to end homelessness among veterans with long or recurrent histories of living on the street.
abstract: Phoenix has become the first American city to end homelessness among veterans with long or recurrent histories of living on the streets; milestone was reached with the help of a program that is centered on an approach called Housing First, through which a home is not treated as a reward for good behavior, but is seen instead as a critical platform for the stability needed to successfully tackle problems like mental illness or addiction.
lead_paragraph: Phoenix has become the first American city to end homelessness among veterans with long or recurrent histories of living on the street.

headline.main: Program to End Homelessness Among Veterans Reaches a Milestone in Arizona
headline.print_headline: Program to End Homelessness Among Veterans Reaches a Milestone in Arizona
